byline.contributor: Kate Pastor, Marc Santora and Rebecca White contributed reporting.

abstract: Shooting during funeral at Emmanuel Church of God in Flatbush, Brooklyn, leaves two dead and four wounded; police believe incident is not gang-related, but part of decades-old dispute between Sharieff Clayton, one of those killed, and unidentified man who is among wounded.
lead_paragraph: A law enforcement official said that lingering ill will played a role in instigating the gun battle, with dozens of shots fired, outside a church on Flatbush Avenue.

headline.main: Fatal Shooting Outside Brooklyn Church Was Set Off by Longtime Dispute, Police Say
headline.print_headline: A Decades-Old Quarrel Is Said to Be at the Center of a Fatal Brooklyn Shooting

snippet: A law enforcement official said that lingering ill will played a role in instigating the gun battle, with dozens of shots fired, outside a church on Flatbush Avenue.
